messages.message:
Anyone else run into problems when trying to build webapp. I tried re-installing npm, and ran `make setup` in /webserver/node. Is there anything else I can do?
```
../src/create_string.cpp:17:25: error: no matching constructor for initialization of 'v8::String::Utf8Value'
  v8::String::Utf8Value string(value);
                        ^      ~~~~~
/Users/heymian/.node-gyp/12.6.0/include/node/v8.h:3002:5: note: candidate constructor not viable: no known conversion from 'v8::Local<v8::Value>' to 'const v8::String::Utf8Value' for 1st argument
    Utf8Value(const Utf8Value&) = delete;
    ^
/Users/heymian/.node-gyp/12.6.0/include/node/v8.h:2995:5: note: candidate constructor not viable: requires 2 arguments, but 1 was provided
    Utf8Value(Isolate* isolate, Local<v8::Value> obj);
    ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [Release/obj.target/binding/src/create_string.o] Error 1
gyp ERR! build error
gyp ERR! stack Error: `make` failed with exit code: 2
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onExit (/Users/heymian/src/instabase/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/build.js:262:23)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:203:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:272:12)
gyp ERR! System Darwin 18.5.0
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/Cellar/node/12.6.0/bin/node" "/Users/heymian/src/instabase/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild" "--verbose" "--libsass_ext=" "--libsass_cflags=" "--libsass_ldflags=" "--libsass_library="
gyp ERR! cwd /Users/heymian/src/instabase/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/node_modules/node-sass
gyp ERR! node -v v12.6.0
```
Not sure who to tag. @Eric Han? @warren?
I think your node version might be too high. we’re still on 8.10
ohh how do i do that?
ohhhhh i think that did it. it’s made it past the part where the errors started spewing!

```
Install nodeenv (or similar version manager) by following the installation instructions here: https://github.com/nodenv/nodenv or using brew as below. You'll need to be able to switch to node8 when you setup the webapp service later. Install and switch to node8 (you can switch to node8 either locally or globally):
$ brew install nodenv
$ nodenv init >> ~/.bash_profile 2>&1
$ source ~/.bash_profile
$ nodenv install 8.10.0
$ nodenv local 8.10.0  or  nodenv global 8.10.0
```
oh dang i didn’t do ^ that. copy pasted a bunch of stuff from stackoverflow
I put this in the Setting up guide!
hahaha yeah i see now. i’m just not sure why my comp decided to suddenly start failing
might wanna uninstall that brew node so you dont run into issues later haha
@Eric Han or @warren can we make some kind of error  if the node is a mismatch based on what we want
